Diploma in Health & Sanitary Inspector (DHSI) - Master Curriculum

1Ô∏è‚É£ Course Overview

Course Introduction: The DHSI program equips students to work primarily with civic bodies and public health departments to enforce hygiene standards, epidemic containment, and sustainable environmental health practices.

  • Objectives: To manage municipal health operations, epidemic out-breaks, food safety inspections, and water sanitation.
  • Duration: 2 Years (4 Semesters)
  • Eligibility Criteria: 10+2 (Any stream with preference to Science).
  • Professional Scope: Vital for municipal corporations, railways, and public sector health enforcement.
  • Regulatory Alignment: Matches WHO and Indian Public Health Standards (IPHS) for grassroots sanitation.

2Ô∏è‚É£ Academic Structure

  • Semester 1: Anatomy basics, Introduction to Public Health, Fundamentals of Sanitation.
  • Semester 2: Communicable Disease Control, Water Purification & Testing, Waste Disposal Methods.
  • Semester 3: Food Safety Regulations, Occupational Health & Safety, Epidemiology Basics.
  • Semester 4: Field Internships at Municipal Zones, Urban Health Centers, and Final Project.

3Ô∏è‚É£ Subject-Wise Detailed Syllabus

Unit: Food Safety & Adulteration (Sem 3)

  • Topic Breakdown: FSSAI guidelines, common adulterants in milk/spices, sampling protocols, cold-chain preservation.
  • Learning Objectives: Ability to conduct field raids, collect legal food samples, and issue improvement notices to vendors.
  • Practical Competencies: Lactometer usage, rapid chemical spot tests for adulterants.

4Ô∏è‚É£ Practical / Clinical Component

  • Field Rotations: Municipal dumping yards, water treatment plants, primary health centers (PHC).
  • Hands-on: Chlorination of wells, fogging machine operation for Vector-Borne Disease Control (VBDC), solid waste segregation audits.

5Ô∏è‚É£ Internship / Field Training Requirements

  • Duration: 6 Months.
  • Posting: Municipal Corporation Health Zones, FSSAI nodes.
  • Logbook Requirement: Document 20 water tests, 10 food stall inspections, 5 outbreak tracing reports.

6Ô∏è‚É£ Assessment Structure

  • Internal Assessment (40%): Field evaluation reports, viva on public health laws.
  • External Examination (60%): Written theory.

üöÄ CAREER & FUTURE GROWTH

  • Government Jobs: Sanitary Inspector in Railways, Municipal Corporation, Defense (Cantonment Boards).
  • Private Sector: F&B Quality Control (Hotels, FMCG), Private Waste Management firms.
  • Salary Range: ‚Çπ18,000 - ‚Çπ35,000/month (Govt 7th Pay Commission scale).

üéì STUDENT ENGAGEMENT CONTENT

  • Certifications: HACCP awareness, FSSAI FOSTAC certification.
  • Monthly Challenge: Real-time mapping of stagnant water bodies in a 2km radius using open-source GIS.

Diploma in Home Care Provider (DHCP) - Master Curriculum

1Ô∏è‚É£ Course Overview

Course Introduction: Designing caregivers who handle step-down care, geriatric care, and palliative scenarios inside a patient's residence.

  • Objectives: To provide safe and localized care, minimizing hospital readmissions for chronic patients.
  • Duration: 2 Years (4 Semesters)

2Ô∏è‚É£ Academic Structure

  • Semester 1: Human Biology, Basic Nursing Skills, Patient Hygiene.
  • Semester 2: Geriatric Care (Aging), Nutrition & Feeding (Ryles Tube, PEG), Medication Management.
  • Semester 3: Palliative & End-of-Life Care, Handling Home ICU Setups (Oxygen, Suctioning).
  • Semester 4: Practical Field Care Training, Infection Control in Home Bounds.

3Ô∏è‚É£ Practical / Clinical Component

  • Procedures: Turning and positioning (bedsore prevention), dressing wounds, colostomy bag care, safe transfer mechanics (bed to wheelchair).

üöÄ CAREER & FUTURE GROWTH

  • Private Sector: Corporate Home Healthcare Agencies (Portea, Nightingales).
  • Entrepreneurship: Independent verified caregivers charge premium per-shift rates.
  • Salary Range: ‚Çπ15,000 - ‚Çπ25,000/month. Special needs/ICU step-down cases yield ‚Çπ30k+.

Diploma in Hospital Administration (DHA) - Master Curriculum

1Ô∏è‚É£ Course Overview

Course Introduction: Focuses heavily on the operational and clerical leadership required in healthcare. Differentiates from DHM by focusing more on operational execution than strategy.

  • Duration: 2 Years (4 Semesters)

2Ô∏è‚É£ Academic Structure

  • Semester 1: Office Management, Hospital Setup, Customer Relations.
  • Semester 2: Inventory Control, Pharmacy Ops, Dietary & Linen Management.
  • Semester 3: TPA and Empanelment, Transport / Ambulance Fleet Management.
  • Semester 4: Hospital Internship & Project Work.

3Ô∏è‚É£ Practical / Clinical Component

  • Hospital Rotations: Support Services (Laundry, Dietary, Pharmacy Stores) and Patient Relations.

üöÄ CAREER & FUTURE GROWTH

  • Roles: Operations Executive, Ward Coordinator, Empanelment Officer.
  • Salary Range: ‚Çπ18,000 - ‚Çπ24,000/month.

Diploma in Hospital Waste Management (DHWM) - Master Curriculum

1Ô∏è‚É£ Course Overview

Course Introduction: Trains students strictly in the protocols of Bio-Medical Waste (BMW) Management to prevent nosocomial infections and environmental contamination.

  • Duration: 1-2 Years
  • Regulatory Alignment: Bio-Medical Waste Management Rules, 2016 (Amended 2018/19).

2Ô∏è‚É£ Academic Structure

  • Semester 1: Types of Hospital Waste, Microbiology of Hospital Environment.
  • Semester 2: Segregation Rules (Color Coding), Collection, Transport.
  • Semester 3: Treatment Modalities (Autoclave, Microwave, Incineration).
  • Semester 4: BMW Auditing, Safety & Occupational Hazards in Waste Handling.

3Ô∏è‚É£ Practical / Clinical Component

  • Hands-on: Handling sharp containers, spill management protocols (Mercury & Blood).

üöÄ CAREER & FUTURE GROWTH

  • Roles: Infection Control Associate, BMW In-charge at large hospitals or Centralized Waste Treatment Facilities (CBMWTF).
  • Certifications: Quality Council of India (QCI) Wash standard auditing.
  • Salary Range: ‚Çπ15,000 - ‚Çπ22,000/month.

Diploma in Medical Laboratory Technology (DMLT) - Master Curriculum

1Ô∏è‚É£ Course Overview

Course Introduction: The backbone of medical diagnostics. DMLT trains technicians to collect samples, run analyses via fully-automated/semi-automated analyzers, and assist pathologists.

  • Objectives: Deliver high-precision laboratory testing in Pathology, Biochemistry, and Microbiology.
  • Duration: 2 Years (4 Semesters)
  • Eligibility: 10+2 Science (PCB/PCM).

2Ô∏è‚É£ Academic Structure

  • Semester 1: Clinical Anatomy, Basic Haematology, Phlebotomy Techniques.
  • Semester 2: Clinical Biochemistry (Metabolites, LFT, KFT), Histopathology (Tissue Processing).
  • Semester 3: Medical Microbiology (Bacteriology, Virology), Serology & Immunology, Blood Banking.
  • Semester 4: Advanced Automation, Lab Quality Control (NABL metrics), Mandatory 6-Month Lab Internship.

3Ô∏è‚É£ Subject-Wise Detailed Syllabus

Unit: Blood Banking & Serology (Sem 3)

  • Topic Breakdown: ABO & Rh grouping, Cross-matching techniques, Coombs Test, Screening for TTIs (HIV, HBV, HCV, Syphilis).
  • Learning Objectives: Maintain blood bank inventory and ensure safe issuing of blood components.
  • Practical Competencies: Apheresis machine operation, Component separation (PRBC, FFP, Platelets).

4Ô∏è‚É£ Practical / Clinical Component

  • Lab-based Training: Handling microscopes, centrifuges, cell counters, and colorimeters.
  • Safety: Strict adherence to BSL-2 protocols for sample handling.

5Ô∏è‚É£ Internship / Field Training Requirements

  • Duration: 6 Months.
  • Posting Departments: Sample Collection, Biochemistry, Hematology, Pathology, Microbiology.
  • Requirements: 200 successful venous blood draws, running 100 complete blood counts (CBC).

6Ô∏è‚É£ Assessment Structure

  • Internal Assessment (30%): Spotters (identifying slides/instruments), daily practical files.
  • External Examination (70%): Practical evaluation of sample processing and written exams.

üöÄ CAREER & FUTURE GROWTH

  • Higher Education: B.Sc MLT, leading to M.Sc in specialized domains.
  • Government Jobs: Lab Technician in state hospitals (huge demand).
  • Private Sector: Pan-India diagnostic chains (Dr. Lal PathLabs, SRL, Metropolis).
  • Entrepreneurship: Operating collection centers/franchises for major labs.
  • Salary Range: ‚Çπ15,000 - ‚Çπ28,000/month.

üéì STUDENT ENGAGEMENT CONTENT

  • Monthly Challenge: "Vein Hunter" Phlebotomy strike rate tracking. Improving first-stick success ratios.
  • Seminars: Understanding CLIA (Chemiluminescence) over conventional ELISA.
